column2: Abstract

column2: An empirical comparison of CFG filtering
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column centered left-indent right-indent hanged-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: techniques for LTAG and HPSG is pre-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: sented. We demonstrate that an approx-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: imation of HPSG produces a more effec-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tive CFG filter than that of LTAG. We also
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: investigate the reason for that difference.

column2: 1 Introduction
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column right-indent font-larger hanged-line shorter-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space numbered-heading1 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Various parsing techniques have been developed
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: for lexicalized grammars such as Lexicalized
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: Tree Adjoining Grammar (LTAG) (Schabes et al.,
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital tailchar-comma

column2: 1988), and Head-Driven Phrase Structure Gram-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line year tailchar-hiphen

column2: mar (HPSG) (Pollard and Sag, 1994). Along with
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower

column2: the independent development of parsing techniques
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: for individual grammar formalisms, some of them
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: have been adapted to other formalisms (Schabes et
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: al., 1988; van Noord, 1994; Yoshida et al., 1999;
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower tailchar-semicolon

column2: Torisawa et al., 2000). However, these realiza-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: tions sometimes exhibit quite different performance
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: in each grammar formalism (Yoshida et al., 1999;
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower tailchar-semicolon

column2: Yoshinaga et al., 2001). If we could identify an al-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: gorithmic difference that causes performance differ-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ence, it would reveal advantages and disadvantages
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: of the different realizations. This should also allow
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: us to integrate the advantages of the realizations into
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: one generic parsing technique, which yields the fur-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ther advancement of the whole parsing community.
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: In this paper, we compare CFG filtering tech-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column left-indent indented-line headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: niques for LTAG (Harbusch, 1990; Poller and
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified hanged-line year headchar-lower

column2: Becker, 1998) and HPSG (Torisawa et al., 2000;
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-capital tailchar-semicolon

column2: Kiefer and Krieger, 2000), following an approach to
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-capital column-bottom

column2: parsing comparison among different grammar for-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified column-top headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: malisms (Yoshinaga et al., 2001). The key idea
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower

column2: of the approach is to use strongly equivalent gram-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: mars, which generate equivalent parse results for the
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: same input, obtained by a grammar conversion as
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: demonstrated by Yoshinaga and Miyao (2001). The
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower

column2: parsers with CFG filtering predict possible parse
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: trees by a CFG approximated from a given grammar.
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: Comparison of those parsers are interesting because
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: effective CFG filters allow us to bring the empirical
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: time complexity of the parsers close to that of CFG
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: parsing. Investigating the difference between the
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: ways of context-free (CF) approximation of LTAG
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: and HPSG will thereby enlighten a way of further
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: optimization for both techniques.
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: We performed a comparison between the exist-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: ing CFG filtering techniques for LTAG (Poller and
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: Becker, 1998) and HPSG (Torisawa et al., 2000),
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-capital tailchar-comma

column2: using strongly equivalent grammars obtained by
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: converting LTAGs extracted from the Penn Tree-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: bank (Marcus et al., 1993) into HPSG-style. We
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower

column2: compared the parsers with respect to the size of the
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: approximated CFG and its effectiveness as a filter.
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: sion (Yoshinaga and Miyao, 2001) and CFG filter-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ing (Harbusch, 1990; Poller and Becker, 1998; Tori-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: 2.1 Grammar conversion
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading2 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: The grammar conversion consists of a conversion
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: of LTAG elementary trees to HPSG lexical entries
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: and an emulation of substitution and adjunction by
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower page-bottom

column2: __Figure 1__
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=-2 left-column centered left-indent right-indent box page-top figure-area above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Figure 1: Extraction of CFG from LTAG
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column centered left-indent right-indent indented-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space string-figure headchar-capital above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: pre-determined grammar rules. An LTAG elemen-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified hanged-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tary tree is first converted into canonical elementary
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: trees which have only one anchor and whose sub-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: trees of depth n (≥ 1) contain at least one anchor. A
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: canonical elementary tree is then converted into an
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: HPSG lexical entry by regarding the leaf nodes as
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: arguments and by storing them in a stack.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: We can perform a comparison between LTAG and
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: HPSG parsers using strongly equivalent grammars
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-capital

column2: obtained by the above conversion. This is because
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: strongly equivalent grammars can be a substitute for
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the same grammar in different grammar formalisms.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 2.2 CFG filtering techniques
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading2 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: An initial offline step of CFG filtering is performed
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: to approximate a given grammar with a CFG. The
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: obtained CFG is used as an efficient device to com-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: pute the necessary conditions for parse trees.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: The CFG filtering generally consists of two steps.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital tailchar-period

column2: In phase 1, the parser first predicts possible parse
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-capital

column2: trees using the approximated CFG, and then filters
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: out irrelevant edges by a top-down traversal starting
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: from roots of successful context-free derivations. In
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: phase 2, it then eliminates invalid parse trees by us-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ing constraints in the given grammar. We call the
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: remaining edges that are used for the phase 2 pars-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ing essential edges.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: The parsers with CFG filtering used in our ex-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: periments follow the above parsing strategy, but are
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: different in the way the CF approximation and the
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: elimination of impossible parse trees in phase 2 are
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: performed. In the following sections, we briefly de-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: scribe the CF approximation and the elimination of
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: impossible parse trees in each realization.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 2.2.1 CF approximation of LTAG
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading3 above-line-space

column2: In CFG filtering techniques for LTAG (Harbusch,
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital tailchar-comma

column2: 1990; Poller and Becker, 1998), every branching of
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified hanged-line year

column2: elementary trees in a given grammar is extracted as
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: a CFG rule as shown in Figure 1.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail itemization headchar-lower tailchar-period column-bottom

column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=-2 right-column centered left-indent right-indent box column-top figure-area above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Figure 2: Extraction of CFG from HPSG
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column centered left-indent right-indent line-double-space line-space string-figure headchar-capital above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Because the obtained CFG can reflect only local
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column left-indent hanged-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: constraints given in each local structure of the el-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ementary trees, it generates invalid parse trees that
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: connect local trees in different elementary trees. In
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: order to eliminate such parse trees, a link between
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: branchings is preserved as a node number which
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: records a unique node address (a subscript attached
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: to each node in Figure 1). We can eliminate these
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: parse trees by traversing essential edges in a bottom-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: up manner and recursively propagating ok-flag from
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: a node number x to a node number y when a connec-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line itemization headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tion between x and y is allowed in the LTAG gram-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: mar. We call this propagation ok-prop.
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 2.2.2 CF approximation of HPSG
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading3 above-line-space

column2: In CFG filtering techniques for HPSG (Torisawa
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital

column2: et al., 2000; Kiefer and Krieger, 2000), the extrac-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified hanged-line year headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tion process of a CFG from a given HPSG gram-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: mar starts by recursively instantiating daughters of a
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: grammar rule with lexical entries and generated fea-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ture structures until new feature structures are not
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: generated as shown in Figure 2. We must impose
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: restrictions on values of some features (i.e., ignor-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ing them) and/or the number of rule applications in
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: order to guarantee the termination of the rule appli-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: cation. A CFG is obtained by regarding each initial
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: and generated feature structures as nonterminals and
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: transition relations between them as CFG rules.
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: Although the obtained CFG can reflect local and
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: global constraints given in the whole structure of
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: lexical entries, it generates invalid parse trees be-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: cause they do not reflect upon constraints given by
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the values of features that are ignored in phase 1.
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: These parse trees are eliminated in phase 2 by apply-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: ing a grammar rule that corresponds to the applied
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: CFG rule. We call this rule application rule-app.

column2: 3 Comparison with CFG filtering

column2: In this section, we compare a pair of CFG filter-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: ing techniques for LTAG (Poller and Becker, 1998)
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower

column2: and HPSG (Torisawa et al., 2000) described in Sec-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tion 2.2.1 and 2.2.2. We hereafter refer to PB and
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: TNT for the C++ implementations of the former and
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: a valiant <sup>1</sup> of the latter, respectively. 2
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line shorter-tail itemization headchar-lower above-line-space

column2: We first acquired LTAGs by a method pro-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: posed in Miyao et al. (2003) from Sections 2-21 of
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified hanged-line year headchar-lower

column2: the Wall Street Journal (WSJ) in the Penn Tree-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: bank (Marcus et al., 1993) and its subsets. <sup>3</sup> We then
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line year headchar-lower

column2: converted them into strongly equivalent HPSG-style
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: grammars using the grammar conversion described
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: in Section 2.1. Table 1 shows the size of CFG ap-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: proximated from the strongly equivalent grammars.
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: G <sub>x</sub> , CFG PB , and CFG TNT henceforth refer to the
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: LTAG extracted from Section x of WSJ and CFGs
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: approximated from G <sub>x</sub> by PB and TNT, respectively.
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: The size of CFG <sub>TNT</sub> is much larger than that of
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: CFG <sub>PB</sub> . By investigating parsing performance using
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: these CFGs, we show that the larger size of CFG <sub>TNT</sub>
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column centered right-indent font-largest aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: resulted in better parsing performance.
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-line-space

column2: Table 2 shows the parse time with 254 sentences
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail line-space string-table headchar-capital

column2: of length n (≤10) from Section 2 of WSJ (the av-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified font-largest hanged-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: erage length is 6.72 words). <sup>4</sup> This result shows not
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: only that TNT achieved a drastic speed-up against
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 1 All daughters of rules are instantiated in the approximation.
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column left-indent indented-line line-double-space line-space numbered-heading1 tailchar-period

column2: 2 In phase 1, PB performs Earley (Earley, 1970) parsing
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column left-indent aligned-line numbered-heading1 year

column2: while TNT performs CKY (Younger, 1967) parsing.
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column right-indent font-smallest hanged-line shorter-tail year headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: 3 The elementary trees in the LTAGs are binarized.
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column left-indent right-indent indented-line longer-tail numbered-heading1 tailchar-period

column2: 4 We used a subset of the training corpus to avoid the com-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column left-indent aligned-line longer-tail numbered-heading1 tailchar-hiphen

column2: plication of using default lexical entries for unknown words.
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column right-indent font-smallest hanged-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period column-bottom

column2: Table 3: The numbers of essential edges with the
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified column-top string-table headchar-capital

column2: strongly equivalent grammars for Section 02 of WSJ
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower above-line-space

column2: __Table 3__
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column centered left-indent right-indent box indented-line shorter-tail line-space table-area above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Table 4: The success rate (%) of phase 2 operations
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column centered left-indent right-indent hanged-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space string-table headchar-capital above-line-space

column2: __Table 4__
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column centered left-indent right-indent box indented-line shorter-tail line-space table-area above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: PB, but also that performance difference between
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified hanged-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: them increases with the larger size of the grammars.
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: In order to estimate the degree of CF approxima-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column left-indent indented-line headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: tion, we measured the number of essential (inactive)
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: edges of phase 1. Table 3 shows the number of the
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: essential edges. The number of essential edges pro-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: duced by PB is much larger than that produced by
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: TNT. We then investigated the effect on phase 2
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: as caused by the different number of the essential
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: edges. Table 4 shows the success rate of ok-prop
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: and rule-app. The success rate of rule-app is 100%, <sup>5</sup>
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: whereas that of ok-prop is quite low. <sup>6</sup> These results
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: indicate that CFG <sub>TNT</sub> is superior to CFG PB with re-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: spect to the degree of the CF approximation.
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: We can explain the reason for this difference by
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: investigating how TNT approximates HPSG-style
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: grammars converted from LTAGs. As described
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: in Section 2.1, the grammar conversion preserves
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the whole structure of each elementary tree (pre-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: cisely, a canonical elementary tree) in a stack, and
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: grammar rules manipulate a head element of the
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: stack. A generated feature structure in the approxi-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: mation process thus corresponds to the whole unpro-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: cessed portion of a canonical elementary tree. This
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: implies that successful context-free derivations ob-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tained by CFG <sub>TNT</sub> basically involve elementary trees
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: in which all substitution and adjunction have suc-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ceeded. However, CFG <sub>PB</sub> (also a CFG produced
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: by the other work (Harbusch, 1990)) cannot avoid
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower

column2: generating invalid parse trees that connect two lo-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 5 This means that the extracted LTAGs should be compatible
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column left-indent indented-line line-double-space line-space numbered-heading1

column2: with CFG and were completely converted to CFGs by TNT.
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column right-indent font-smallest hanged-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: 6 Similar results were obtained in preliminary experiments
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail numbered-heading1

column2: using the XTAG English grammar (The XTAG Research Group,
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified font-smallest hanged-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: 2001) without features (parse time (sec.)/success rate (%) for
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified font-smallest aligned-line year

column2: PB and TNT were 15.3/30.6 and 0.606/71.2 with the same sen-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified font-smallest aligned-line headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: tences), though space limitations preclude complete results.
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column right-indent font-smallest aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period page-bottom

column2: cal structures where adjunction takes place between
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified page-top headchar-lower

column2: them. We measured with G <sub>2</sub> - 21 the proportion of the
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: number of ok-prop between two node numbers of
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: nodes that take adjunction and its success rate. It
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: occupied 87% of the total number of ok-prop and
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: its success rate was only 22%. These results sug-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: gest that the global contexts in a given grammar is
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: essential to obtain an effective CFG filter.
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: It should be noted that the above investigation also
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: tells us another way of CF approximation of LTAG.
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: We first define a unique way of tree traversal such as
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: head-corner traversal (van Noord, 1994) on which
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower

column2: we can perform a sequential application of substitu-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tion and adjunction. We then recursively apply sub-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: stitution and adjunction on that traversal to an ele-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: mentary tree and a generated tree structure. Because
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the processed portions of generated tree structures
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: are no longer used later, we regard the unprocessed
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: portions of the tree structures as nonterminals of
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: CFG. We can thereby construct another CFG filter-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: ing for LTAG by combining this CFG filter with an
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: existing LTAG parsing algorithm (van Noord, 1994).
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 4 Conclusion and future direction
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column right-indent font-larger aligned-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading1 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: We presented an empirical comparison of LTAG and
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: HPSG parsers with CFG filtering. We compared the
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: parsers with strongly equivalent grammars obtained
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: by converting LTAGs extracted from the Penn Tree-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: bank into HPSG-style. Experimental results showed
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: that the existing CF approximation of HPSG (Tori-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: sawa et al., 2000) produced a more effective filter
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower

column2: than that of LTAG (Poller and Becker, 1998). By in-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: vestigating the different ways of CF approximation,
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: we concluded that the global constraints in a given
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: grammar is essential to obtain an effective filter.
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: We are going to integrate the advantage of the CF
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: approximation of HPSG into that of LTAG in order
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: to establish another CFG filtering for LTAG. We will
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: also conduct experiments on trade-offs between the
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: degree of CF approximation and the size of approx-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: imated CFGs as in Maxwell III and Kaplan (1993).
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column right-indent aligned-line year headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space
